metadata.title: CVE-2020-15720 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In Dogtag PKI through 10.8.3, the pki.client.PKIConnection class did notenable python-requests certificate validation. Since the verify parameterwas hard-coded in all request functions, it was not possible to overridethe setting. As a result, tools making use of this class, such as thepki-server command, may have been vulnerable to Person-in-the-Middleattacks in certain non-localhost use cases. This is fixed in 10.9.0-b1.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
